meanings.definition: An examination of a body after death to determine the cause of death.
meanings.sent1: The veterinarian conducted a necropsy on the deceased dog to find out why it passed away.
meanings.sent2: The necropsy revealed that the cause of death was a severe heart condition.
meanings.sent3: During the necropsy, the vet discovered a hidden chew toy in the dog's stomach, solving the mystery.
meanings.sent4: The necropsy was like a detective unraveling a puzzling case of a sudden demise.
meanings.sent5: The necropsy painted a clear picture of the final moments of the animal's life.

meanings.definition: The act of performing an autopsy on an animal.
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper scheduled a necropsy for the lion that had passed away unexpectedly.
meanings.sent2: The necropsy procedure on the elephant was conducted with precision and care.
meanings.sent3: The necropsy on the parrot turned into a comical scene when it unexpectedly squawked during the examination.
meanings.sent4: Performing a necropsy on the horse felt like exploring a mysterious world within its body.
meanings.sent5: The necropsy on the rabbit was a detailed exploration of its internal organs.
